description: Pakistani air strikes targeted seven militant camps in Afghanistan, including a religious madrassa. Islamabad stated the operations were in response to recent suicide bombings within Pakistan, blaming militants operating from Afghan soil. Kabul condemned the strikes, accusing Pakistani generals of deflecting from their own security failures. Relations between the two neighbours have deteriorated sharply since the Taliban returned to power in 2021.

title: Dwarka accident: Roads that cut lives short

Of these, a simple question haunts: why does wearing a helmet still require persuasion?

title: After tariff setback, Trump attacks US companies & attorneys with India ties
description: President Trump fiercely attacked the Supreme Court after it struck down his tariffs, accusing the justices of being "lapdogs for the radical left" and influenced by foreign interests. The ruling, a 6-3 decision, reinforced Congress's trade powers, marking a significant setback for the President's executive actions.

title: Bezos's ex-wife's record $7.2bn donation in 2025 called 'bad donation', Musk agrees

Tan argues her lack of oversight fosters mismanagement, likening it to "pouring sugar on the floor" and citing examples of alleged chaos and unintended consequences at recipient organizations.

title: Bride's pet dog sparks violent clash in UP, wedding cancelled
description: A wedding in Fatehpur turned violent after a pet dog's barking led to a brawl between the bride's and groom's families. The disturbance during rituals escalated when the groom's side allegedly attacked the animal, resulting in a physical fight. At least five people were injured, and the ceremony was called off. No formal complaint has been lodged yet.

title: FBI warns of ATM Jackpotting incidents across America: All you need to know
description: Cybercriminals are increasingly targeting ATMs with 'jackpotting' malware, forcing machines to dispense cash without legitimate transactions. The FBI warns of a surge in these attacks, with significant financial losses reported. Threat actors exploit physical and software vulnerabilities, bypassing security to gain direct control and trigger rapid cash withdrawals, often leaving ATMs unexpectedly out of service.

title: Who is Pernille Døsvik? Inside Johannes Klæbo’s fiancée and love story
description: Johannes Høsflot Klæbo is one of the biggest stars in winter sports. The Norwegian cross-country skier has dominated the Olympics and World Cup circuit for years. Off the snow, his personal life has also drawn attention. Klæbo is engaged to Pernille Døsvik, a young professional from Trondheim. The couple confirmed their engagement in June 2025 after several years together. Fans often see her supporting him during competitions and training periods.
